data.title: Sensei Wu's Secret Mission
data.solution:
line1 = input().split()
N = int(line1[0])
P = int(line1[1])

powers = input().split()
for i in range(len(powers)):
    powers[i] = int(powers[i])

powers.sort(reverse=True)

total_power = 0
for power in powers:
    if total_power + power <= P:
        total_power += power

print(total_power)
data.statement:
Sensei Wu must select a team of ninjas for a secret mission. The mission requires a target power of [[P]]. He has [[N]] ninjas, each with their own unique power. If the team's combined power exceeds [[P]], the secret mission's discretion will be compromised!
Wu follows a strict rule: he always selects the most powerful ninjas first to ensure the mission is successfully completed.
What is the total power of the team Wu will send on this mission?
data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 20, 1 ≤ [[P]] ≤ 1000
 The powers of each ninja is between 1 and 100
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int P:int
loopline N power:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: Two integers [[N]] and [[P]] , the number of ninjas and the target power
<<Line 2>>: [[N]] integers separated by spaces, representing the powers of the ninjas
data.outputDescription: An [[integer]] representing the maximum total power that does not exceed [[P]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Sensei Wu must select a team of ninjas for a secret mission. The mission requires a target power of P. He has N ninjas, each with their own unique power. If the team's combined power exceeds P, the secret mission's discretion will be compromised!
Wu follows a strict rule: he always selects the most powerful ninjas first to ensure the mission is successfully completed.
What is the total power of the team Wu will send on this mission?
Input
Line 1: Two integers N and P , the number of ninjas and the target power
Line 2: N integers separated by spaces, representing the powers of the ninjas
Output
An integer representing the maximum total power that does not exceed P
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 20, 1 ≤ P ≤ 1000
The powers of each ninja is between 1 and 100
Example
Input
4 10
5 4 3 2
Output
9
